line.token: * This file is part of Composer.

* file that was distributed with this source code.
'Do not validate requires for overly strict/loose constraints'
'Check if lock file is up to date (even when config.lock is false)'
'Do not check if lock file is up to date'
'Do not report a warning if the version field is present'
'Also validate the composer.json of all installed dependencies'
'Return a non-zero exit code for warnings as well as errors'
The validate command validates a given composer.json and composer.lock
Exit codes in case of errors are:
1 validation warning(s), only when --strict is given
'- The lock file is not up to date with the latest changes in composer.json, it is recommended that you run `composer update` or `composer update <package name>`.'
'" is in the lock file as "'
'" but that does not satisfy your constraint "'
'" is not present in the lock file.'
'This usually happens when composer files are incorrectly merged or the composer.json file is manually edited.'
'Read more about correctly resolving merge conflicts https://getcomposer.org/doc/articles/resolving-merge-conflicts.md'
'and prefer using the "require" command over editing the composer.json file directly https://getcomposer.org/doc/03-cli.md#require'
// $errors include publish and lock errors when exists
' is invalid, the following errors/warnings were found:</error>'
' is valid for simple usage with Composer but has</info>'
'<info>strict errors that make it unable to be published as a package</info>'
' is valid, but with a few warnings</info>'
' is valid but your composer.lock has some '
'<warning>See https://getcomposer.org/doc/04-schema.md for details on the schema</warning>'
// Avoid setting the exit code to 1 in case --strict and --no-check-publish/--no-check-lock are combined
// If checking publish errors, display them as errors, otherwise just show them as warnings
// If checking lock errors, display them as errors, otherwise just show them as warnings
